ht_0025.subtitles:
WEBVTT Nimbus Service Procedure ht_0025

00:00.000 --> 00:05.000
- Enter the "Main" menu by selecting and pressing the "Menu" button

00:05.000 --> 00:09.000
- Enter the "Service" menu by selecting and pressing the "Service" button

00:09.000 --> 00:15.000
- Enter the "Diagnostics" screen by selecting and pressing the "Diagnostics" button (The "Manual Control" button on versions prior to 1.0)

00:15.000 --> 00:19.000
- Select the "Steam Valve" DO on the "Digital Outputs" frame

00:19.000 --> 00:23.000
- Press the "OK" button to activate the "Steam Valve" DO

00:23.000 --> 59:59.000
- Insert one lead of the multimeter to any socket between the 12. and the 22. sockets on the S11 socket group and insert the other lead of the multimeter to the 7. socket on the S13 socket group

ht_0138.subtitles:
WEBVTT Nimbus Service Procedure ht_0138

00:00.000 --> 00:07.000
- Enter the "Main" menu by selecting and pressing the "Menu" button

00:07.000 --> 00:11.000
- Enter the "Service" menu by selecting and pressing the "Service" button

00:11.000 --> 00:16.000
- Enter the "I/O Link" screen by selecting and pressing the "I/O Link" button

00:16.000 --> 00:38.000
- Select the Steam Valve DO

00:38.000 --> 00:40.000
- Press the "OK" button to enter the edit mode

00:40.000 --> 59:59.000
- Change the current DO to one of the available DOs by pressing the up-down direction buttons

ht_0026.subtitles:
WEBVTT Nimbus Service Procedure ht_0026

00:00.000 --> 00:07.000
- Press the "OK" button to assign the target DO

00:07.000 --> 00:10.000
- Press the "Exit" button to exit. At this stage the software will ask you if you want to save the changes. To save your changes select the "Yes" button by pressing the left-right direction buttons and press the "OK" button to confirm the selection

00:10.000 --> 00:16.000
- The software will return to the "Service" menu

00:16.000 --> 00:28.000
- Detach the S13 socket plug from the back of the Control Panel

00:28.000 --> 00:50.000
- Remove the 7. socket terminal from the S13 socket plug by pushing down the fins of the socket terminal with the terminal removal tool

00:50.000 --> 00:55.000
- Attach the S13 socket plug into the S13 socket

00:55.000 --> 01:11.000
- Raise up the fins of the socket terminal with the terminal removal tool

01:11.000 --> 01:16.000
- Detach the S19 socket plug from the back of the Control Panel

01:16.000 --> 01:23.000
- Insert the socket terminal into the 6. socket of the S19 socket plug which corresponds to the DO which has been assigned in the DO assignment step in this video (Step no 1). Warning: You have to select the corresponding socket and socket plug if you choose another DO for this procedure. You can find a list of the DOs and their corresponding sockets on the back of the Control Panel

01:23.000 --> 01:29.000
- Attach the S19 socket plug into the S19 socket

01:29.000 --> 01:35.000
- Enter the "Diagnostic" screen by selecting and pressing the "Diagnostic" button

01:35.000 --> 01:40.000
- Select the "Steam Valve" DO on the "Digital Outputs" frame

01:40.000 --> 01:44.000
- Press the "OK" button to activate the "Steam Valve" DO

01:44.000 --> 59:59.000
- Check the voltage value by inserting one lead of the multimeter into any socket between the 12. and the 22. sockets on the S11 socket group and inserting the other lead of the multimeter into the 6. socket on the S19 socket group

ht_0029.subtitles:
WEBVTT Nimbus Service Procedure ht_0029

00:00.000 --> 00:10.000
- Unscrew the control valve socket holder screw from the steam control valve coil by using a screwdriver

00:10.000 --> 00:17.000
- Detach the steam valve coil socket from the steam control valve coil

00:17.000 --> 00:22.000
- Detach the terminal block of the socket from its housing by using the screwdriver as a lever

00:22.000 --> 59:59.000
- Check the voltage between the terminals of the terminal block by using a voltmeter

ht_0030.subtitles:
WEBVTT Nimbus Service Procedure ht_0030

00:00.000 --> 59:59.000
- Open the rear cover, the top covers, and the front left door and replace the cable

ht_0159.subtitles:
WEBVTT Nimbus Service Procedure ht_0159

00:00.000 --> 00:05.000
- Enter the "Main" menu by selecting and pressing the "Menu" button

00:05.000 --> 00:09.000
- Enter the "Service" menu by selecting and pressing the "Service" button

00:09.000 --> 00:15.000
- Enter the "Diagnostics" screen by selecting and pressing the "Diagnostics" button (The "Manual Control" button on versions prior to 1.0)

00:15.000 --> 00:19.000
- Select the "Steam Valve" DO on the "Digital Outputs" frame

00:19.000 --> 59:59.000
- Press the "OK" button to activate the "Steam Valve" DO

ht_0027.subtitles:
WEBVTT Nimbus Service Procedure ht_0027

00:00.000 --> 00:16.000
- Check the resistance value between the terminals of the steam control valve coil terminals by using a multimeter

00:16.000 --> 00:20.000
- Attach the terminal block of the socket into its housing

00:20.000 --> 00:24.000
- Insert the socket holder screw into its screw hole

00:24.000 --> 00:29.000
- Attach the steam valve coil socket onto the steam control valve coil

00:29.000 --> 59:59.000
- Screw the coil socket onto the coil via its holder screw by using a screwdriver

ht_0028.subtitles:
WEBVTT Nimbus Service Procedure ht_0028

00:00.000 --> 00:11.000
- Unbolt the plastic nut which fastens the coil onto the coil armature on the back of the valve

00:11.000 --> 00:24.000
- Remove the coil from the steam control valve by pulling it downwards from the front side of the coil along the armature (back of the machine)

00:24.000 --> 00:39.000
- Install the new coil onto the steam control valve by pushing it upwards from the front side until the coil reaches the base of the armature (back of the machine)

00:39.000 --> 00:52.000
- Bolt the plastic nut which fastens the coil onto the armature whilst pushing the coil upwards

00:52.000 --> 00:57.000
- Attach the steam valve coil socket onto the new coil

00:57.000 --> 59:59.000
- Screw the coil socket onto the coil via its holder screw by using a screwdriver

ht_0031.subtitles:
WEBVTT Nimbus Service Procedure ht_0031

00:00.000 --> 59:59.000
- Check the reliability of the hose between the Steam Piston Valve and the
Steam Control Valve by detaching the hose from the steam output fitting
of the Steam Control Valve and observing the air flow

ht_0084.subtitles:
WEBVTT Nimbus Service Procedure ht_0084

00:00.000 --> 00:05.000
- Unplug the hose from the steam control valve

00:05.000 --> 00:20.000
- Follow the cable route and free the cable from its clips

00:20.000 --> 00:25.000
- Unplug the other end of the hose from the steam valve

00:25.000 --> 59:59.000
- Plug the new hose into the steam valve and get the hose clipsed and plug the other end of the hose into the steam control valve

ht_0032.subtitles:
WEBVTT Nimbus Service Procedure ht_0032

00:09.000 --> 00:11.000
- Unplug the air hose from its fitting on the steam piston valve

00:11.000 --> 59:59.000
- Check the airflow by holding the tip of the hose towards your hand or towards something which can flap by airflow

ht_0033.subtitles:
WEBVTT Nimbus Service Procedure ht_0033

00:00.000 --> 00:10.000
- Unplug the air hose from its fitting on the steam piston valve

00:10.000 --> 00:42.000
- Detach the steam piston valve from the connection pipe by unbolting it using a pipe wrench

00:42.000 --> 01:44.000
- Attach the new steam piston valve onto the connection pipe by bolting it using a pipe wrench. Tighten the valve whilst bolting it

01:44.000 --> 01:54.000
- Plug the air hose into the fitting on the steam piston valve

01:54.000 --> 01:58.000
- Select the "Steam Valve" DO on the "Digital Outputs" frame

01:58.000 --> 02:00.000
- Press the "OK" button to activate the "Steam Valve" DO

02:00.000 --> 02:04.000
- Press the "OK" button to deactivate the "Steam Valve" DO

02:04.000 --> 59:59.000
- Check the movement of the indicator rod on the steam piston valve visually

ht_9009.subtitles:
WEBVTT Nimbus Service Procedure ht_9009

00:00.000 --> 00:03.000
- You will need the door latch key

00:03.000 --> 00:08.000
- Release the latch

00:08.000 --> 59:59.000
- Swing the panel left
